description: Borrowed from Middle French organisation, from Medieval Latin organizātiō; by surface analysis, organize +‎ -ation.

examples: This painting shows little organization at first glance, but little by little the structure becomes clear.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The way in which something is organized, such as a book or an article.
examples: The organization of the book is as follows.

entries.meaning: (countable) A group of people or other legal entities with an explicit purpose and written rules.
examples: In response to the crisis, the nations in the region formed an organization.   If you want to be part of this organization, you have to follow its rules.

entries.meaning: (countable) A group of people consciously cooperating.
examples: Over time, the spontaneous movement had become an organization.

entries.meaning: (baseball) A major league club and all its farm teams.
examples: He's been in the Dodgers' organization since 2003.
